metadata.titel_preek: The Master and the Best Man

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God enters human history in the person of Jesus Christ to rescue a human race that is in a 'desperate fix' and cannot save itself through spiritual techniques.

tekstueel_bewijs: the one in whose person the Kingdom of God has arrived
the one and only Lord of lasting peace and justice is on his way
sinners in need of a Savior
all the people of the world will find their true salvation
begotten of his father before all worlds
the human race is in a desperate fix
nothing to give you but Jesus

helper.identificatie: John the Baptist / The Preacher / Aunt Mary Virginia
tekstueel_bewijs: the one who points away from himself to Christ
the herald out of the wilderness
the human race is in a desperate fix
massacre on the Long Island Railroad
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but a 'desperate fix' evidenced by murder and systemic human failure that masters/teachers cannot solve.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The witness of the 'Best Man' (John/Preacher) who must decrease so Christ can increase.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Witness (John the Baptist/Preacher/Aunt)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (witness) is entirely dependent on the primary program (the arrival of the Bridegroom).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → Jesus (Salvation) → The Desperate Human Race
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: John the Baptist → Jesus ← Sin/Death/False Optimism

voorbeelden_god_subject: the Kingdom of God has arrived
He abhors not the Virgin’s womb
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we would judge him to have gone off the deep end
the human race does not need any more spiritual masters

voorbeelden: He must increase, but I must decrease
one must love the Dalai Lama for that
the matter of who he was is not so well understood
the human race is in a desperate fix [lacks power]
the one and only Lord... is on his way [has power]

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the total lack of 'Pouvoir' (ability) in humans to save themselves, contrasted with the absolute 'Pouvoir' of Christ as 'the Master'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (Dalai Lama/Masters) to S2 (The LIRR massacre/Real Sin) to S1 (The Nicene Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Nicene Dogma'—that only 'Very God' can bridge the gap from S2 to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the mention of the LIRR massacre and the shopkeeper's death grounds the need for grace in visceral reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly rejects exemplarism and focuses on the person and nature of Christ as the sole source of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in John the Baptist
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: John has set the example for us all.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The human race does not need any more spiritual masters; it needs a Savior.
not on what he taught, but on who he was

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: John the Baptist is called an 'example', but specifically an example of 'decreasing'—pointing away from the self.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: John is not a hero to imitate but a signpost to read.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and comfort; the burden of 'being a master' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God acts, man receives.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon perfectly integrates the biblical text, the liturgical season, and the dogmatic tradition.
spanning_punten: The tension between Jesus as 'Teacher' (admired by 9/10) and Jesus as 'God' (the 'Nicene' necessity).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: sinners in need of a Savior... God from God... Lo! he abhors not the Virgin’s womb

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on Christology; the Spirit's role is implicit in the 'joy' of the witness.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as a 'desperate fix' that spiritual techniques cannot touch.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's descent into a broken world. The preacher successfully maintains the 'Subject' status of Christ.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong emphasis on Savoir (Knowing who Jesus is).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; the 'Savoir' serves the 'Pouvoir' of God.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly intensified through the LIRR massacre example.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics. It uses the Actantial Model to strip away human pretension and center the narrative entirely on the ontological reality of Christ.

comparatiele_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'Dalai Lama' hook, semiotics reveals that this hook serves to contrast human 'Subject' (Master) with divine 'Subject' (Savior).
comparatiele_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains John 3; semiotics shows how the preacher uses John 3 to re-order the hearer's world-view from anthropocentric to theocentric.
comparatiele_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'Best Man' is a Helper actant whose success is defined by his own disappearance, reinforcing the 'Subject' status of the Bridegroom.

volledige_subject_lijst: The preacher has nothing to give
appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of Fleming Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace'.
